title: Attack Move that Targets Closest Enemy to CLICK (not champion)
body:
Hi guys,

I've recently bound my attack move button (not 'attack only button') to my left click on my mouse (MB1), which is great because:

1) you use it when enemy champions run into bushes to target them straight away when you see them
2) it stops you accidentally running towards the target if you accidentally miss the target

However, the problem is, when you try to say, hit a champion when you are near minions with attack move, and your cursor is not exact on the champion, your champion will  automatically attack the CLOSEST enemy TO YOUR CHAMPION. So you will hit minions, instead of hitting the enemy champion.

I've tried using the 'attack only' button as well - but the problem here is that if you miss the target, it will not doing anything (better than running towards them), but what i want is:

**Is there a way to attack move the CLOSEST ENEMY TARGET to the MOUSE LOCATION, so that if I miss the target by a little bit, as long as it's still the closest enemy target to my click, it will attack that, and move in range if it's not in range?**

replies.body: Would "Target Champions Only" work? You use it by default from the tilde key ( ` ) or ( ~ ). If only it was toggleable, rebinding it sucks.

short answer no.

long answer, that would be pretty OP compared to ppl who dont use it.
